title: William Herschel Telescope
summary: The William Herschel Telescope (WHT) is a 4.20-metre (165Â in) optical/near-infrared reflecting telescope located at the Observatorio del Roque de los Muchachos on the island of La Palma in the Canary Islands, Spain. The telescope, which is named after William Herschel, is part of the Isaac Newton Group of Telescopes.  It is funded by research councils from the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Spain.
